pkgmetadata.longdescription: Optimal Level of Significance for Regression and Other Statistical Tests // The optimal level of significance is calculated based on a decision-theoretic approach. The optimal level is chosen so that the expected loss from hypothesis testing is minimized. A range of statistical tests are covered, including the test for the population mean, population proportion, and a linear restriction in a multiple regression model. The details are covered in Kim and Choi (2020) doi:10.1111/abac.12172, and Kim (2021) doi:10.1080/00031305.2020.1750484.
